codeSystems.name: ChLabBloodGroupAntibodyScreen
codeSystems.title: CH LAB-Report BloodGroup Antibody Screen Test (LOINC codes)
codeSystems.description:
This value set is used in the ChLabObservationBloodGroup profile. It represents
atypical IgG antibodies prior to transfusion or during pregnancy. The screening test is designed
specifically to detect IgG antibodies and some IgM antibodies (non ABO) may also be detected.
Antibodies detected by the antibody screen should then be identified, and a titer performed if
the antibody identified is considered to be clinically significant during pregnancy.

codeSystems.name: ChLabBloodGroupAntibody
codeSystems.title: CH LAB-Report BloodGroup Antibody Result (SNOMED CT coded substances)
codeSystems.description:
This value set is used in the ChLabObservationBloodGroup profile. It contains results of Blood Group Antibodies
(substance) coded with SNOMED CT. It is used in the ChLabObservationBloodGroup profile

codeSystems.name: ChLabBloodGroupImmunoHematology
codeSystems.title: CH LAB-Report BloodGroup Immunohematology Tests (SNOMED CT coded procedures)
codeSystems.description: This value set is used in the ChLabObservationBloodGroup profile. It contains Laboratory tests related to immunohematology

codeSystems.StructureDefinition-ch-lab-observation-r: CH LAB-Report Observation Results: Erythrocyte distribution width by Automated count

codeSystems.name: LaboratoryResultStandardEuVs
codeSystems.title: Laboratory Code
codeSystems.description: Laboratory observation codes. List of Laboratory observation codes derived from the LOINC and NPU code systems.
codeSystems.StructureDefinition-ch-lab-observation-r: CH LAB-Report Observation Results: Laboratory Report

codeSystems.name: LabOrderCodesEuVs
codeSystems.title: Laboratory Order
codeSystems.description: List of LOINC Laboratory codes of type 'Order' or 'Both. This value set is built upon the IPS value set 'Results Laboratory Observation - IPS'

codeSystems.name: LabReportTypesEuVs
codeSystems.title: Laboratory Report Types
codeSystems.description:
Laboratory Report Types.
This version includes only one code as suggested by the eHN guideline.
Category can be used for filtering per study type or specialty.

codeSystems.name: LabSpecialtyEuVs
codeSystems.title: Laboratory Specialty
codeSystems.description:
Laboratory Specialties.
Notes:
Note 1: This value set is based on analysis of national coding practices in 8 European countries (AT, CZ, DE, FR, IE, IT, PT, SE) and agreed by involved lab experts as a common lab specialty value set.
Note 2: Many European countries are using additional laboratory specialty types, which should be mapped towards this value set.
Note 3: In case of documented need, this value set could be extended.
codeSystems.StructureDefinition-ch-lab-observation-r: CH LAB-Report Observation Results: Laboratory Report

codeSystems.name: LabSpecimenAdditiveEu
codeSystems.title: Specimen Additive
codeSystems.description: List of the specimen additives. Additives are commonly added to the vacutainer tubes to preserve the specimen for laboratory analysis

codeSystems.name: LabSpecimenContainerEu
codeSystems.title: Specimen Container
codeSystems.description: List of the containers commonly used to collect specimens (e.g. urine, blood,..).

codeSystems.name: LabStudyTypesEuVs
codeSystems.title: Laboratory Study Types
codeSystems.description:
Laboratory Study Types
Notes:
Note 1:26436-6 (Laboratory studies) enables issuing a report putting together observations from multiple specialties (disciplines) in the same text block, allowing delivery of a global interpretation comment at the end of the text block that will be rendered at the end of the report.
Note 2:Mycology and parasitology, as well as bacteriology, are part of the 18725-2 (Microbiology studies (set)) studies.
Note 3:Virology MAY be included in 18725-2 (MICROBIOLOGY STUDIES) or 18727-8 (SEROLOGY STUDIES) or split between both study types, depending upon the Content Creator Actorâ€™s choice.
codeSystems.StructureDefinition-ch-lab-observation-r: CH LAB-Report Observation Results: Laboratory Report

codeSystems.name: LabTechniqueEuVs
codeSystems.title: Laboratory Techniques
codeSystems.description: Laboratory technique (method of measurement) used for the result measurement (based on SNOMED CT).
codeSystems.StructureDefinition-ch-lab-observation-r: CH LAB-Report Observation Results: Laboratory Report

codeSystems.name: SNOMEDCTBodyStructures
codeSystems.title: SNOMED CT Body Structures
codeSystems.description: This value set includes all codes from [SNOMED CT](http://snomed.info/sct) where concept is-a 442083009 (Anatomical or acquired body site (body structure)).

codeSystems.name: ResultsCodedValuesLaboratoryUvIps
codeSystems.title: Results Coded Values Laboratory - IPS
codeSystems.description: This value set is defined as the union of: (a) Blood group [Type]; (b) Presence/Absence Indicators (2.16.840.1.113883.11.22.52) (c) Microorganisms (2.16.840.1.113883.11.22.49)
codeSystems.StructureDefinition-ch-lab-observation-r: CH LAB-Report Observation Results: Laboratory Report
